About Explorations...and other things mra2 related.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): About Explorations...and other things mra2 related.
By Gizmo the Lemur on Tuesday, November 19, 2002 - 12:19 pm:

...I finally have permission to go to a place called Tapota when I want to explore stuff. You get it through a variety of scenarios after you hit D class. First, you'll meet a free lance trainer whose monster (a Golem) was hurt. Holly will let him rest, and as a reward, you can make his Golem a coach (Use him for flip).

Then you'll probably meet your second rival named hunter, and this time the fight is optional (I defeated him with my Raiden). Finally, after the Hunter incident, you'll see Mr. Karnab from FIMBA (Karn in MR1) who will tell you that he got permission from AGIMA to explore Tapota.

I don't know if you have to be a certain rank to go on expeditions so I am going to have to check it out when I make another monster (My Raiden's too dumb for trips. He's meant for fighting).

As for the rest, it seems that you can develop traits with the coaches while you can also get traits in certain conditions. When I trained with the Mocchi Holly brought along for the first few tries, my Raiden and Mogi both developed UpMind. The Golem I just mentioned gae my Raiden the UPEarth trait, and due to the eight million E-Class battles my Raiden went through or his popularity, he also developed a trait called "Popularity".

I just thought you might be interested in knowing about expeditions and traits.

By Gizmo the Lemur on Tuesday, November 19, 2002 - 01:08 pm:

pt. 2 (Just a brief update)

I just got another place to explore. It's in a snowy rrgion called Malkt, a place that is supposed to be forbidden for trainers. You have to be at least a level 2 breeder to get it, and Karnab (Karn) will ask you to help him go there because Mr. Mardoc won't let him or anyone else fo there. Being the inquisitive person, Karn forces you to go anyway, but when you go there, you'll be attacked by a robber. Defeat him, and you'll return to the ranch.

To go there at anytime, you have to be a level 3 trainer, and have a B-ranked monster, or a monster with a rank higher than B.

I forgot to mention that according to the booklet, it says that "accidents" can happen while you right random monsters in expeditions. I hope it doesn't mean that they get lost like they did in MR1.

There's a neat feature in mra2 called soulmates where monsters your pet can cooperate with can help it in battle sometimes. They do different things from healing to skill boosts, but from what I heard from Aroma, they only work in official battles.

Aroma seems to be the only person you can make as a soul mate (maybe you can do it with other rivals, but I am not sure). I'd try it through the GBA link, but I am not going to buy another GBA and another MRA2. Most of the people I hang out with don't play MR, and I am not that hardcore.

Strays are also in MRA2. I just fought one with my C-Class Raiden.

By iniqquitous on Friday, November 22, 2002 - 03:44 pm:

By Gizmo the Lemur on Friday, November 22, 2002 - 07:34 pm:

Sorry these responses came late:

Chris
Amity cups are supposed to be in the following: FIMBA Amity Cup (Feb. 1st week), and then AGIMA (Augts 3rd week), The only A class fight that's in March is The Dynamite cup, and that's a Tribe only match. I think you missed it, but it should always show up a month before they occur (e.g. first week of January for the FIMBA). I think you also have to pass the FIMBA Amity Cup first before you can get to the other cup.

Oh yeah, I think I already covered the idea that monsters get lost in expeditions earlier yesterday, but if I didn't, thanks for letting me know while confirming it for me. O appreciate it :0)

This special training "issue" is kinda odd because my Suzurins never had problems getting into them. Maybe you have to go to the FIMBA amity in February first, then hit the IMA amity cup.

"Training" has something to do with the plot. Someone failed to raise a Joker after winning an invite, and now AGIMA is forcing trainers to earn the invitation matches by finding proof that monsters like Durahan exist. "Training" can be found when you go to the AGIMA section when you hit the town.

They send you to a place like Tapota or Malkt to find "proof". It's just an expedition that ends when you find the items AGIMA asks for. Once you find "proof" regarding the monster they might let you raise, you'll get an invite from Bolzoi a month before the match begins.

Inqquitious:
It's kinda tough for me to describe the Warrior/Durahan statue in Tapota, but I'll give it my best shot. It should be around the area where there are a group of pillars that have three obstacles that need to be smashed. Once you past the obstacles, look around the southern-western part of that area. You should see a silver statue of a Durahan, and hopefully you'll find the proof to get Duraha, Dragon, or Zan (Joker's different).

I hoped I helped both of you.

from Nov1-Nov2

By GoldenBoy on Saturday, December 7, 2002 - 09:16 am:

General Exploration info:

The amt of energy you have to search is based on
your Life. It seems to max out at about 700 steps
though.

By MJ on Saturday, December 7, 2002 - 05:33 pm:

speaking of UP MIND I noticed something. If your monster is training with another monster (such as the moochi) if you look at thier traits list you can find what they have. After awhile you monster will have some of one of the traits "rub off" onto your monster (I.E. Training a Golem in intellegence and using a Suezo teacher will get the golem to acquire Eagle Eye (not guaranteed though). Just one of my many thoughts.

By Thorr on Saturday, December 7, 2002 - 07:17 pm:

This is what Coaches are for. That is why it's important to choose your coaches wisely.

-Thorr

By Anonymous on Thursday, December 12, 2002 - 12:03 pm:

Not only with other coaches, my Tiger developed (and lost) Glutton while training and also after a good amount of Intelligence training (Meditate) I got Up IQ. And Popular when my Fame got near 100.

By GoldenBoy on Thursday, December 12, 2002 - 12:18 pm:

I've been working with characteristics a lot and
they seem to fall into 4 categories.

Earned- Get them from fighting e.g. Dignity and
Popular

Learned- Learned from a coach. Can be most
anything, have yet to see how well Charisma
improves transfers.

Metabolic- Gained based on how you train the
monster. Glutton happens to most babies, also
Listless can crop up.

Potential- Come from training the monster in
certain drills Up IQ is most common.

By nikolace on Tuesday, December 17, 2002 - 02:30 am:

My Garu/SP had 100 fame for over a year before it developed the Popular trait. And I have also had many other garu's with 100 fame that never got this trait.

By Thorr on Tuesday, December 17, 2002 - 05:28 am:

Popularity doesn't spring up when you get to 100. It just helps you to get there faster. Popularity will most likely pop up if you win your first official tournament in a short amount of time. With 3 of my monsters, I won the Class E official in 2 months. All of them got a 30+ point popularity increase and they acquired the Popular trait. It's still kinda worthless, though.

-Thorr

By GoldenBoy on Tuesday, December 17, 2002 - 08:48 am:

The development of popular also seems to have
something to do with how well you do in fights,
and possibly the breed (ahhh those fickle fans).

I get popular all the time no matter what breed I
raise, it's like fleas. This is because I tend to
seriously overmatch my competition before I
fight. In fact I do my best to fill up my traits
so I don't have to deal with popular.

Unfortunately this prevents me from learning more
about getting good earned traits like dignity.

By Thorr on Tuesday, April 22, 2003 - 05:04 am:

You need to get the invitation June 1, then it will show up on your calendar. And be sure your monster has done all of the great 4 himself.

-Thorr
